author: rorellana
title: El papa dice que hay que tener el valor de "negociar" el fin de la guerra en Ucrania
text:
El papa dice que hay que tener el valor de "negociar" el fin de la guerra en Ucrania
El papa Francisco dijo que en la guerra de Ucrania se deberÃ­a tener "el coraje de la bandera blanca" y "negociar", que es una "palabra valiente", para lograr el final del conflicto, en una entrevista a la Radio TelevisiÃ³n Suiza de la que hoy se publicaron algunos extractos.
"Creo que es mÃ¡s fuerte quien ve la situaciÃ³n, quien piensa en el pueblo, quien tiene el valor de la bandera blanca, de negociar. Y hoy se puede negociar con la ayuda de las potencias internacionales. La palabra negociar es una palabra valiente", dijo el pontÃ­fice recogiendo la expresiÃ³n "bandera blanca" usada previamente por el entrevistador.
"Cuando ves que estÃ¡s derrotado, que las cosas no van, debes tener el valor de negociar", aÃ±adiÃ³ el pontÃ­fice.
En el mismo sentido y refiriÃ©ndose a la guerra de Gaza, el papa dijo: "Negociar nunca es rendirse".
La entrevista serÃ¡ emitida Ã­ntegra el prÃ³ximo 20 de marzo.
Lea tambiÃ©n: Putin advierte a OTAN que las consecuencias de envÃ­o de tropas a Ucrania serÃ­an "trÃ¡gicas"
"No se avergÃ¼encen de negociar, antes de que la situaciÃ³n empeore", dijo Francisco, que ha hecho numerosos llamamientos a favor de la paz en la "martirizada Ucrania" y que mandÃ³ a su enviado para el conflicto, el cardenal italiano Matteo Zuppi, a reunirse con las autoridades en Kiev, MoscÃº y Washington.
Tras publicarse la entrevista, la Santa Sede matizÃ³ que el papa no habla de rendiciÃ³n sino de negociaciÃ³n, segÃºn el portavoz vaticano, Matteo Bruni, citado por los medios italianos.
"El papa utiliza el tÃ©rmino bandera blanca, y responde tomando la imagen propuesta por el entrevistador, para indicar con ella el cese de las hostilidades, la tregua alcanzada con el valor de la negociaciÃ³n. En otro momento de la entrevista, hablando de otra situaciÃ³n de conflicto, pero refiriÃ©ndose a cualquier situaciÃ³n bÃ©lica, el papa afirma claramente: 'la negociaciÃ³n nunca es rendiciÃ³n'", dijo.
SegÃºn Bruni, "el deseo del papa sigue siendo el que ha repetido siempre en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os (...): 'Mientras renuevo mi mÃ¡s profundo afecto por el atormentado pueblo ucraniano y rezo por todos, en particular por las innumerables vÃ­ctimas inocentes, imploro que encontremos esa pizca de humanidad que nos permita crear las condiciones para una soluciÃ³n diplomÃ¡tica en la bÃºsqueda de una paz justa y duradera'".

author: @WBRCnews
title: â€˜She was her grandkidsâ€™ best friendâ€™: Daughter mourns mother killed in tornado
text:
COLUMBIA, Tenn. ( WSMV /Gray New) - A family is grieving after a woman was killed in Wednesdayâ€™s tornado in middle Tennessee.
Family members said 67-year-old Cheryl Lovett touched so many lives. The loving mother and grandmother was taken in the blink of an eye.
â€œShe was just an amazing person. She was wonderful,â€ her daughter Brianne Lovett said.
Brianne Lovett said her whole world changed in a matter of seconds. In one single moment, she lost not only her mother but also her house and nearly everything she owned.
Brianne Lovett said the sound of rushing wind was one of the last things she heard before losing nearly everything.
â€œI was on the back porch just watching,â€ she said. â€œI had just gotten home from work. I just watched it get quiet, and then I started noticing the wind.â€
Brianne Lovett said the next thing she knew, her whole world was spinning.
â€œAfter I got everybody and the dogs in the closet. I dove head-first into the closet and that was when the tornado had taken my house. Itâ€™s just gone,â€ Brianne Lovett said.
She said she tried to call and warn her mother up the street, but it was too late.
â€œShe may have been asleep in her room, but she was at home,â€ she said.
Brianne Lovett said both her mother and aunt were thrown out of their home. They found her aunt and rushed her to Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Unfortunately, her mother Cheryl Lovett was found dead.
â€œShe was mine and my brotherâ€™s best friend. She was her grandkidsâ€™ best friend,â€ Brianne Lovett said. â€œYou couldnâ€™t make her mad. She was always smiling. She was always happy. She was a wonderful person. I never wanted for anything.â€
She said her family isnâ€™t the only ones grieving this loss. Brianne Lovett said the family found her motherâ€™s dog Lulu safe and sitting in one of her chairs.
â€œMy son went up there to try and find as much of my momâ€™s stuff as he could for me, and he found [Lulu] sitting in one of my momâ€™s chairs,â€ Brianne Lovett said.
Brianne Lovett is sending out a message after Wednesdayâ€™s tornado.
â€œJust listen,â€ she said. â€œI know they said tornado warning, and people around here, we were the same way, we thought itâ€™s not going to happen, itâ€™s not going to happen, and it happened. It happened. Just take cover.â€
A GoFundMe page has been set up to help the family recover.
Copyright 2024 WSMV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: RedacciÃ³n LAVOZ
title: Entre lÃ¡grimas, GastoÌn Paredes se despidiÃ³ de radio MÃ­a
text:
El conductor GastÃ³n Paredes cerrÃ³ una etapa en radio MÃ­a este miÃ©rcoles y se despidiÃ³ de su audiencia con un sentido mensaje y la voz completamente quebrada.
â€œPerdÃ³n que se me rompa un poco la voz, pero es imposible no emocionarse despuÃ©s de 10 aÃ±os de una historia hermosa que hemos hecho juntos. Pero bueno, fue difÃ­cil tomar una decisiÃ³n sobre un cambio que tenÃ­a y que venÃ­a sintiendo dentro de un tiempo. Esa decisiÃ³n es que no voy a seguir mÃ¡s en la radio, a la cual le debo muchoâ€, arrancÃ³ diciendo.
Luego de repasar su historia en la conducciÃ³n de la radio, Paredes agradeciÃ³ a la audiencia por los lindos aÃ±os que compartieron juntos y asegurÃ³ que se va feliz por todo lo que pasÃ³ en este tiempo.
â€œHoy me toca decirles chau una parte de mi vida muy importante. VivÃ­ con mi vieja cuando empecÃ© a trabajar acÃ¡ con mi papÃ¡ tambiÃ©n, formÃ© una familia, me mudÃ©, tuve mi hija y compartÃ­ con ustedes todas esas alegrÃ­as hermosas. Hoy tambiÃ©n con alegrÃ­a me voy y eso es justamente lo que quiero compartir con ustedes. Y que sea asÃ­, decirles chau, decirles graciasâ€, dijo entre muchas otras cosas.

author: Cristina Laila
title: There It Is! Kamala Harris Brags About Casting the Tie-Breaking Vote to Let IRS Crack Down on Tipped Workers - And the Crowd Claps Like Trained Seals (VIDEO) | The Gateway Pundit | by Cristina Laila
text: Joe and Kamala held a rally in the corner of a gym at Prince Georgeâ€™s County Community College in Maryland. This is the first time Kamala and Joe have appeared together in public since Kamala forced Biden off the ballot 25 days ago. Kamala Harris still has not done one press conference or answered any questions since she stole all of Bidenâ€™s delegates. Joe and Kamala told the paltry crowd on Thursday that they lowered prescription drug costs for the American people. Kamala Harris admitted she cast the tie-breaking vote to let the IRS crack down on tipped workers. She actually bragged about being the tie-breaking vote! And the audience clapped like trained seals. â€œI was proud to cast the tie-breaking vote that sent the billâ€¦ to the presidentâ€™s desk! And I was proud that our president Joe Biden signed that bill into law!â€ Harris said. WATCH: â€” Trump War Room (@TrumpWarRoom) August 15, 2024 The so-called â€˜Inflation Reduction Actâ€™ added more than 80,000 new IRS agents to the agency to track tipped workers and $600 Venmo payments. â€œOn this vote, the yayâ€™s are 50, the nayâ€™s are 50. The Senate being equally divided, the vice president votes in the affirmative and the bill as amended is passed,â€ Harris said in the August 7, 2022, video. Kamala Harris shamelessly stole President Trumpâ€™s â€˜no tax on tipsâ€™ idea and not one person in the media is calling her out for being the one to cast the tie-breaking vote that allowed the IRS to track down tipped workers.

author: Kunal Singh
title: â€œThis Bit** Canâ€™t Runâ€- Floyd Mayweather Gets Stern Warning From â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ Anthony Taylor Prior To Boxing Return
text:
There are a lot of speculations regarding
Floyd Mayweather potentially returning to boxing return. Although having been retired back in 2017, the 47-year-old fighter was often seen in exhibition bouts. But if word of mouth is true, the American might return to fight Victor Ortiz in the boxing ring. However, before his much-anticipated comeback, he found an unusual call-out.
In a recent Instagram post, â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ Anthony Taylor shared a customized poster of him fighting Mayweather. Well,
Taylor is certainly not the opponent for the 47-year-old, he indeed is eyeing out the former boxing legend.
â€œThis B*tch canâ€™t run no more! See you soon kid,â€ â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ wrote in his caption.
Mayweatherâ€™s last boxing match was against
Conor McGregor in 2017. Facing the â€˜Notoriousâ€™ at The Money Fight, the American seemed in his top game. Eventually, he defeated the Irish UFC star via TKO. He ended his career undefeated, winning all 50 professional boxing matches.
â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ Anthony Taylor Challenged Floyd Mayweather Back in 2022
Ahead of Mayweatherâ€™s exhibition bout against YouTuber Deji on November 13, 2022, Taylor expressed his desire to face â€˜Moneyâ€™ in the boxing ring. Interestingly, â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ was in the undercard of Mayweather vs. Deji fight card that day.
Despite Taylorâ€™s challenge, Mayweather decided not to accept a fight with the 35-year-old. Although â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ did claim to be the most eligible guy to face â€˜Moneyâ€™ in an exhibition match, his pleas were constantly overlooked.
Click on â€˜Follow Usâ€™ and get notified of the most viral Boxing stories via Google!
Follow Us
Floyd Mayweather is making his boxing return again. And â€˜Pretty Boyâ€™ Anthony Taylor is still after the boxing legend. Will â€˜Moneyâ€™ accept the 35-year-oldâ€™s challenge? If he does, it can surely be an interesting matchup for boxing fans.
Also Read:
Floyd Mayweather Hails LeBron James and Bronny James as â€˜Powerful Black Menâ€™ After LA Lakers Ropes In Father-Son Duo

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Scorching Struggles: Surviving Gaza's Summer Heat | Science-Environment
text:
Scorching Struggles: Surviving Gaza's Summer Heat
In the war-torn Gaza Strip, residents like Rida Abu Hadayed face intensified hardships in the sweltering summer heat. Displaced families struggle with severe water shortages and inadequate sanitation, exacerbating health risks. Fuel scarcity hampers crucial water production, leaving 93% of Gazan households facing dire water shortages.
Rida Abu Hadayed endures significant challenges as a sweltering summer compounds daily struggles in the embattled Gaza Strip.
Cramped living in a nylon tent, her children suffer from severe heat as temperatures soar above 30 degrees Celsius. The region faces critical water shortages, with crippling effects on sanitation and health.
The dire situation is compounded by a severe scarcity of fuel, hindering crucial water production operations and leaving the majority of Gazans to ration and walk long distances for water. Aid agencies warn of cascading health issues if the situation persists.
(With inputs from agencies.)
Advertisement

author: Shaun Gallagher; Eric Miller; Jessica Patrick; Delaney Eyermann
title: 6-year-old girl injured in drive-by shooting at Cumberland County home
text: 6-year-old girl injured in drive-by shooting at Cumberland County home A child was injured Wednesday night by a bullet that pierced through the wall of a Cumberland County home. At 11:40 p.m., the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office was dispatched to a home on Pleasant View Drive, east of Fayetteville, in reference to a drive-by shooting. When deputies arrived, they found the home empty with multiple bullet holes sprayed across the front. A 6-year-old is being treated at a local hospital and is expected to recover, the sheriff's office said. Three people were inside the home when shots were fired, but no one was injured. A family with multiple children lives in the home, according to neighbors. Neighbors told WRAL News they heard 10 to 15 gunshots then looked outside shortly after to see neighbors and deputies running toward the yard. One bullet even hit a neighboring house owned by Kim Cowger. "I heard seven fast shots and my son came running into the room," said Cowger. "Of course, I called 911." No arrests have been made. The Cumberland County Sheriffâ€™s Office is asking anyone with information to come forward. People can call 910-677-5495 or 910-323-1500 (after-hours). Anonymous tips can be submitted through Crime Stoppers, 910-483-TIPS (8477). Trending â€¢Credits [Shaun Gallagher](/rs/bio/21361269/) [Eric Miller](/rs/bio/19857606/) [Jessica Patrick](/rs/bio/15970652/) [Delaney Eyermann](/rs/bio/20685366/)

author: TrÃ© Goins-Phillips
title: Chinese Government Cracks Down on Leading Christian Prayer App, Bans It From Download
text: In China, the Bible is not safe. In fact, even Christian apps are on the chopping block. The latest app to face the axe is Pray.com, a platform filled with faith-based content, daily Bible-reading plans, and spiritual development programs. The app, according to [a press release](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/pray-com-addresses-apple-app-190000646.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAIMgGgmR4iddLKIPegC1t165DOb-luNkNy6I2zWVmts9hI8xjpEZNO1TosrdP76GH48P5obketw9dBxO3TR2otzXYI5Nw1us1tOL7W5PwghblNTjwTtw1Y3OYkd7z7MPs0igJpMkEKqouOPQKAGr0xZSERmZ5JgUmFeSrbjXFZmb) issued this week, is being removed from the Apple App Store in mainland China. Listen to them on the latest episode of â€œQuick Startâ€ ðŸ‘‡ Its removal from the App Store in the communist country falls under the purview of Chinaâ€™s â€œMeasures for the Administration of Internet Religious Information Services,â€ which went into effect in March 2022. According [to the Congressional-Executive Commission on China](https://www.cecc.gov/prior-restraints-on-religious-publishing-in-china#:~:text=The%20Chinese%20government%20forbids%20private,enterprises%20approved%20by%20the%20government.), an independent agency of the U.S. government monitoring human rights in China, the restrictions put in place in 2022 require a government-issued permit to post religious content and outright ban the online airing of religious ceremonies, events, and worship services. The removal of the Pray.com app comes ahead of the National Day of Prayer on May 2. â€œSince starting Pray.com, weâ€™ve grown accustomed to positive relations with China,â€ said cofounder Michael Lynn. â€œPresident Xi [Jinping] has allowed for the printing of nearly 150 million Bibles per year, and [former] President [Donald] Trump ensured that Bibles were exempt from Chinese tariffs.â€ Steve Gatena, founder and CEO of Pray.com, said in the press release that he and his team are â€œexploring alternative avenues to deliver our content and services to people in mainland China.â€ â€œAs we work on a solution,â€ he said, â€œI want to personally extend an invitation to President Xi Jinping to join us for this yearâ€™s National Day of Prayer event in Washington, D.C.â€ CBN News has reached out to Pray.com and will update this story with any statements from the ministry. The Chinese government is no stranger to censorship. Under Xiâ€™s regime, the Chinese Communist Party is even [reportedly rewriting Scripture](https://www.faithwire.com/2022/02/17/chinas-communist-government-is-reportedly-rewriting-the-bible-and-calling-jesus-a-sinner-but-thats-not-all/) and calling Jesus a â€œsinner.â€ According to The Voice of the Martyrs, a watchdog monitoring Christian persecution around the world, the CCP announced in 2019 it would begin the process of â€œupdat[ing] the Bible to â€˜keep pace with the times.'â€ â€œThe revisions will include adding â€˜core socialist valuesâ€™ and removing passages that do not reflect communist beliefs,â€ VOM said. â€œIn a textbook for high school students released in September 2020, the authors included a passage from John 8, as revised in their new version.â€ Last year, [as CBN News reported](https://www2.cbn.com/news/cwn/chinese-communists-latest-crackdown-forcing-registration-religion-app-sparks-persecution), Chinese officials are testing out an app that would require citizens to pre-register before attending religious services. â€œThis spring, in Henan province, they rolled out an app to get approval to go to any kind of religious service,â€ said Todd Nettleton of VOM. â€œWhat that means is, you need to have the app on your phone.â€ â€œYou need to pre-register in order to go to a religious gathering, give the Chinese government all of your information, tell them who you are, where you live, your ID information, and so forth,â€ he added. You can read more about that [here](https://www2.cbn.com/news/cwn/chinese-communists-latest-crackdown-forcing-registration-religion-app-sparks-persecution). ***As the number of voices facing big-tech censorship continues to grow, please sign up for [Faithwireâ€™s daily newsletter](https://www.faithwire.com/newsletter/) and download the [CBN News app](https://www1.cbn.com/cbn-apps#cbn-news), developed by our parent company, to stay up-to-date with the latest news from a distinctly Christian perspective.***

organizations.name: administration of internet religious information services

author: CNN Newsource
title: Firefighter on plowing route notices house fire, rescues people and pets
text:
Firefighter on plowing route notices house fire, rescues people and pets
By Rob Polansky
Click here for updates on this story
TRUMBULL, Connecticut (
WFSB) â€” A firefighter plowing streets in Trumbull just happened to come upon a house fire and ended up rescuing four people and three dogs.
Shaun Bogenâ€™s quick actions were credited with saving the victimsâ€™ lives.
Fire Chief Greg Sanfanandre of the Long Hill Fire Department reported that the fire had been underway on Haviland Drive around 3:50 a.m. on Sunday.
â€œWhile on his plowing route, firefighter Bogen found a house with a fire in the garage,â€ Sanfanandre said. â€œBogen quickly radioed into his base, alerting them of the situation, and called 911. He proceeded to wake the sleeping residents, four adults and three dogs, in the home and ensured everyone was outside before the Fire Departmentâ€™s arrival.â€
Twenty-six firefighters ended up responding to the fire.
Sanfanandreâ€™s unit was the first unit to arrive and found heavy fire in the garage that extended into the home.
â€œFirefighters attacked the fire utilizing three hose lines and brought the fire under control in less than one hour,â€ he said.
There didnâ€™t appear to be any injuries.
The cause of the fire remained under investigation.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: finanzen.net Redaktion
title: Vorsicht bei Hotel-Bewertungen: Warum man Online-Meinungen nicht blind vertrauen sollte | finanzen.net
text:
Home Geld, Karriere & Lifestyle Vorsicht bei Hotel-Bewertungen: Warum man Online-Meinungen nicht blind vertrauen sollte Verbraucherschutz Vorsicht: Warum man Hotel-Bewertungen im Internet nicht trauen sollte 01.05.25 06:53 Uhr Hotel-Bewertungen im Internet kÃ¶nnen hilfreich sein und das auf der offiziellen Website gezeigt Bild hilfreich ergÃ¤nzen - man sollte sich jedoch nicht zu sehr auf die Bewertungen verlassen: Es gibt sogar Agenturen, die mit dem FÃ¤lschen von Hotel-Bewertungen Geld verdienen.
Werbung
"Ãœber Bewertungen arbeiten sich Verbraucher zu einer Entscheidung hin", erklÃ¤rt Tatjana Halm, Leiterin des Referats fÃ¼r Markt und Recht bei der Verbraucherzentrale Bayern, gegenÃ¼ber der Informationsplattform ntv. Dabei solle man jedoch unbedingt Vorsicht walten lassen: Die Hotelbetreiber wissen, welchen Einfluss Bewertungen auf die Wahl der Unterkunft haben kÃ¶nnen - viele versuchen, ihren Ruf mittels geschÃ¶nter Bewertungen zu verbessern. Werbung Werbung
Expertin: Es gibt unzÃ¤hlige Wege, eine Bewertung zu fÃ¤lschen
Wie viele gefÃ¤lschte Hotel-Bewertungen im Netz kursieren, lÃ¤sst sich laut Halm kaum einschÃ¤tzen: "Auch, weil es so viele Wege zum FÃ¤lschen gibt." Teilweise wÃ¼rden Hotelbetreiber sogar Agenturen dafÃ¼r bezahlen, besonders gute Bewertungen zu schreiben. Andere Betreiber bestechen ihre GÃ¤ste vor Ort, indem sie einen Preisnachlass oder eine PrÃ¤mie im Tausch gegen eine gute Bewertung anbieten, erzÃ¤hlt Halm.
Bei der vom Bewertungsportal HolidayCheck gegrÃ¼ndete Initiative gegen Bewertungsbetrug, der mittlerweile 16 Mitglieder angehÃ¶ren, heiÃŸt es: "In den letzten Jahren wuchs der Markt fÃ¼r kaufbare Fake-Bewertungen besonders stark und wurde durch sogenannte Bewertungsagenturen nicht nur internationalisiert, sondern in groÃŸem MaÃŸe professionalisiert." Abgesehen von dem ungerechtfertigten Wettbewerbsvorteil fÃ¼r manipulierende Unternehmen fÃ¼hre dies auch regelmÃ¤ÃŸig zu falschen Entscheidungen der Endverbraucherinnen und -verbraucher, die sich stark auf Bewertungen verlassen.
Wie kÃ¶nnen Endverbraucher mit Hotel-Bewertungen umgehen?
GefÃ¤lschte Hotel-Bewertungen zu erkennen, "kÃ¶nnen Sie vergessen", erklÃ¤rt Halm. Selbst, wenn ein Hotel nach vielen schlechten Bewertungen plÃ¶tzlich eine gute Bewertung erhÃ¤lt, beweise dies keinen Betrugsfall - es kÃ¶nne auch sein, dass der Betreiber gewechselt hat und die Unterkunft seither wirklich qualitativ hochwertiger wurde. Und: Auch bei Bewertungsportalen, die extrem viel Aufwand betreiben, um gefÃ¤lschte Bewertungen herauszufiltern, "kann man sich nie sicher sein, ob die Bewertungen alle sauber sind". Dies bestÃ¤tigt auch Georg Ziegler aus der Abteilung fÃ¼r Betrugsverfolgung bei HolidayCheck gegenÃ¼ber ntv: Die FÃ¤lschungen seien "oft so gut gemacht, dass selbst ein QualitÃ¤tsmanagement, wie es etwa bei uns vorgeschaltet ist, die gefÃ¤lschten Bewertungen nicht erkennen kann." Werbung Werbung
Nichtsdestotrotz kÃ¶nne man sicher sein: Je grÃ¶ÃŸer der Aufwand, den das Bewertungsportal betreibt, desto weniger gefÃ¤lschte Bewertungen. Halm rÃ¤t, immer auf unterschiedlichen Plattformen nach Bewertungen zu einem Hotel zu suchen. So lasse sich Ã¼berprÃ¼fen, ob ein stimmiges Bild der Unterkunft gezeigt wird. AuÃŸerdem empfiehlt sie, sich Ã¼ber die Rolle der Hotel-Bewertungen bei der Entscheidung fÃ¼r eine Unterkunft bewusst zu werden. Als Orientierungshilfe seien Bewertungen durchaus angemessen - wenn Bewertungen jedoch das ausschlaggebende Kriterium fÃ¼r eine Buchung sind, laufe man hÃ¶here Gefahr, am Ende nicht das zu kriegen, was man haben wollte.
Urteile im Bereich Bewertungsbetrug werden oft nicht durchgesetzt
Im Mai wurde in Deutschland eine neue Richtlinie eingefÃ¼hrt , die Portalen mehr Transparenz bei der Bewertung und bei Rankings vorschreibt. Dazu zitiert die Initiative gegen Bewertungsbetrug Ziegler in einer Pressemitteilung wie folgt: "Die Politik hat erkannt, dass gefÃ¤lschte Bewertungen ein Problem sind. Die MaÃŸnahmen, die dagegen ergriffen werden, sind jedoch bei weitem nicht ausreichend. Auch die Omnibus-Richtlinie wÃ¤lzt die Verantwortung weiter allein auf die Portale ab." WÃ¤hrend die Gerichte seit Jahren Urteile gegen organisierte BetrÃ¼ger fÃ¤llen, sei die Durchsetzung dieser Urteile so gut wie unmÃ¶glich. HolidayCheck zufolge sei die Umsetzung der Urteile jedoch der entscheidende Punkt, der das FÃ¤lschen von (Hotel-)Bewertungen unattraktiv machen kÃ¶nnte.
Bis die Urteile wirklich durchgesetzt werden und die BetrugsfÃ¤lle abnehmen, mÃ¼ssen sich Urlauber also zunÃ¤chst darauf konzentrieren, Hotel-Bewertungen richtig einzuschÃ¤tzen und ihre Buchungsentscheidung auch auf Grundlage anderer Kriterien zu fÃ¤llen.
Redaktion finanzen.net
